intro: Hieracium persolum, commonly known as the Persian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its yellowish-orange flowers bloom in summer, and the plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Hieracium persolum is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
